page.title: 12ECOLOGY OF ATWORTH
page.content: ECOLOGY_ANIMAL LIFE The ecology of the area has changed little over the years.In recent years some grubbing out of hedges has occured,but due to the heavy soil there is little danger of erosion.Many of the fields are bordered with drystone walls of Cornbrash and support,together with attendant verges, a fair ammount of plant growth and make a good habitat for insects and small mammals. The Wiltshire Trust for Nature Conservation is,at present,involved in a habitat mapping scheme of the area. Pheasants are plentiful as are foxes,while bats inhabit the old quarry workings.Rabbits and other small rodents and one would assume badgers are present.
